instruction: What kinds of spectrum was used in the related study to distinguish the geographical origin of white asparagus samples from different countries?
Output: In the related study, the H-1 NMR (proton nuclear magnetic resonance) spectrum was used to distinguish the geographical origin of white asparagus samples from different countries.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used in the related study to distinguish the geographical origin of white asparagus samples from different countries?
Output: Machine learning methodologies were applied to successfully distinguish the geographical origin of white asparagus samples from different countries in the related study.

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the classification accuracy of the geographical origin of white asparagus samples in the related study to distinguish the geographical origin of white asparagus samples from different countries?
Output: The metric chosen to evaluate the classification accuracy of the geographical origin of white asparagus samples was accuracy percentage.

instruction: How did the researchers analyze the influence of year and variety on the classification of asparagus from different German regions in their study on distinguishing the geographical origin of white asparagus samples?
Output: The researchers analyzed the influence of year and variety on the classification of asparagus from different German regions by using nontargeted H-1 NMR metabolomics combined with machine learning methodologies. They applied support vector classification to the data and evaluated the accuracy of the classification. By comparing the results, they were able to determine the influence of year and variety on the classification of asparagus samples from different German regions.

instruction: Can the combination of nontargeted H-1 NMR metabolomics and machine learning be considered a superior method for distinguishing the geographical origin of white asparagus samples compared to traditional methods?
Output: Yes.Based on the information provided in the text, the combination of nontargeted H-1 NMR metabolomics and machine learning can be considered a superior method for distinguishing the geographical origin of white asparagus samples compared to traditional methods. The study achieved an accuracy of 91.5% for classifying the geographical origin of the samples using support vector classification. Additionally, when compared to the established method of isotope-ratio mass spectrometry (IRMS), the NMR method had a higher accuracy of 79.4% compared to 70.9% for IRMS. Therefore, the combination of nontargeted H-1 NMR metabolomics and machine learning shows promise as an effective and accurate method for determining the geographical origin of white asparagus samples.
